agent_id.description: The ID of the agent to use for this completion.

frequency_penalty.description: frequency_penalty penalizes the repetition of words based on their frequency in the generated text. A higher frequency penalty discourages the model from repeating words that have already appeared frequently in the output, promoting diversity and reducing repetition.
frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. The token count of your prompt plus `max_tokens` cannot exceed the model's context length.
max_tokens.title: Max Tokens

messages.description: The prompt(s) to generate completions for, encoded as a list of dict with role and content.

examples.content: Who is the best French painter? Answer in one short sentence.

closed.description: Whether the thinking chunk is closed or not. Currently only used for prefixing.
closed.title: Closed

closed.description: Whether the thinking chunk is closed or not. Currently only used for prefixing.
closed.title: Closed

prefix.description: Set this to `true` when adding an assistant message as prefix to condition the model response. The role of the prefix message is to force the model to start its answer by the content of the message.
prefix.title: Prefix

closed.description: Whether the thinking chunk is closed or not. Currently only used for prefixing.
closed.title: Closed

messages.title: Messages

n.description: Number of completions to return for each request, input tokens are only billed once.
n.title: N

prediction.title: Prediction
prediction.description: Enable users to specify expected results, optimizing response times by leveraging known or predictable content. This approach is especially effective for updating text documents or code files with minimal changes, reducing latency while maintaining high-quality results.

presence_penalty.description: presence_penalty determines how much the model penalizes the repetition of words or phrases. A higher presence penalty encourages the model to use a wider variety of words and phrases, making the output more diverse and creative.
presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty

prompt_mode.description: Allows toggling between the reasoning mode and no system prompt. When set to `reasoning` the system prompt for reasoning models will be used.

random_seed.description: The seed to use for random sampling. If set, different calls will generate deterministic results.
random_seed.title: Random Seed

type.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables JSON mode, which guarantees the message the model generates is in JSON. When using JSON mode you MUST also instruct the model to produce JSON yourself with a system or a user message.
type.title: ResponseFormats

stop.description: Stop generation if this token is detected. Or if one of these tokens is detected when providing an array
stop.title: Stop

stream.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. If set, tokens will be sent as data-only server-side events as they become available, with the stream terminated by a data: [DONE] message. Otherwise, the server will hold the request open until the timeout or until completion, with the response containing the full result as JSON.
stream.title: Stream

anyOf.description: ToolChoice is either a ToolChoiceEnum or a ToolChoice

function.description: this restriction of `Function` is used to select a specific function to call
function.title: FunctionName

anyOf.title: ToolChoice

closed.description: Whether the thinking chunk is closed or not. Currently only used for prefixing.
closed.title: Closed

prefix.description: Set this to `true` when adding an assistant message as prefix to condition the model response. The role of the prefix message is to force the model to start its answer by the content of the message.
prefix.title: Prefix
